lexUnit.name: clap.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: strike the palms of (one's hands) together repeatedly

sentence.text: ` But what a find ! " cried the Headmaster , clapping his hands together .
Marco clapped his hands .
She clapped her hands in inspiration .
The way they clapped their hands to the music , sang the words , and applauded rapturously after each number .
Cranston clapped his hands together .
When Boris clapped his paws , like magic the farm came alive .
But you never saw the king of beasts clap his forepaws nor balance a ball on his nose !
They were in a straight line but when Boris clapped his paws they began to march .
Clapping their wings the gulls came back from the sea ,
They clapped in chorus .
To the first verse everyone claps in time with the music .
When the number ended he clapped in a careful way , unconsciously trying.to say exactly what he felt about it .
` The decent people clapped like hell , and the rogues behaved themselves .
They were singing and clapping to the rhythm .
Everyone cheered him again and clapped loudly .
Mr Mafouz was clapping loudly .
The passengers clapped very loudly , to encourage him .
Again and again he clapped and the doll kept laughing .
They still clapped and applauded enthusiastically when he was finished , but it did n't help .
As Colin French was taken away by police animal rights supporters in the public gallery began to cheer and clap .
